caption: It’s a good place for whoever wants spicy food. For me it’s not bad
Excellent. I don't know where to get better Szechuan food in NYC. Try the bamboo shoots.

Wonderful experience! We ordered the Griddle Okra, Mapo Tofu, Chongqing Spicy Chicken, and Chengdu Pork Dumplings. Everything was delicious and service was speedy and kind. The only reason I don't have photos to share is because we dove into the food so quickly- next time!

This place slaps! I was looking for a place to try Suan Cai Yu aka Chongqing Sour Fish after watching a Chinese Cooking Demystified video on it. Well that turned into a large takeout order, everything was fantastic! The Spicy Chicken was a ton of fun, made with high quality szechuan peppercorns that have a strong numbing without that overwhelming sour taste. The beef lung was mild and refreshing, and the sour fish soup was everything I dreamed of and more. I can't wait to go back and try exploring more of their menu!
So so good on a chilly evening.
Food was cold and taste old,dinner $30 a person was definitely not worth it.waitress was rude and hovered around to see if she was getting a tip.will never return.waste of money.
(Translated by Google) too salty  (Original) 太咸了
so so delicious and perfect! also has great service! can’t wait to try the rest of the menu. i think this is easily one of the best chinese restaurants in the city.
I literally spend a casual afternoon over there, staffs friendly,  a solid 4.5 stars.

(Translated by Google) The service is very good and the dishes are not tasty. Last time the three of us went to dinner and ordered a teal soup, which was almost boiling water duck soup, 🙃The taste of duck is almost gone It didn't move. At the checkout, the waiter asked whether the soup should be packed. We said that the taste was not good, so we didn't want it. As a result, their manager came over and said that they returned the two dishes, which cost 25 yuan for soup and 13 yuan for dishes, to the card and waited for the next meal to be used against cash. We ate more than 160 and gave 200 for the rest as tips. And this time I went there. It was not about the money in the card. It was just an ordinary 9 discount card. I felt cheated. Why don't you even say that the money is returned to the card? Never go again after that. Legit sichuanese food, as good as can be found in Chungdu.
Best Szechuan in town

(Translated by Google) Ordered dry pot cabbage, spicy chicken, pickled bullfrog, and frogfish. The taste is okay, the amount is really small, I don’t know, I thought I ordered a bunch of chili, side dishes and juice, I’m really not full  (Original) 点了 干锅包菜 辣子鸡 泡椒牛蛙 麻麻鱼 。 味道还行，量是真的少 不知道的都以为我点了一堆辣椒 配菜 跟汁水 真的吃不饱

Picked up takeout tonight and had a great experience all around. Food was ready quickly and hot enough to make it home and still be warm. We ordered the Mapo tofu (spicy, perfectly textured and saucy), griddled cauliflower (great flavor and texture), fish-flavored eggplant (divine) and the Chengdu noodle special (fantastic, just wish it had a little more vegetables with it).  Food was great, service was easy and quick, portion sizes very reasonable, prices affordable, and will absolutely order again.

My order was efficiently delivered and nicely packed.  The dishes made me homesick, they were so tasty 😋 I planned to have this order for two dinners, but the dishes were more than I thought and took me three days to finish all of them haha~  The only thing was that the fish was not as fresh as I ate in the restaurant, so it was a little bit lack of resilience? Hope I can enjoy it in the restaurant soon 🙏🏻  Everything else 👍🏻

This place is back open for pick up or delivery!! So good! If you are missing authentic szechuan cooking, look no further! If you get the odd “this number is not receiving messages” recording, just call back. It means they are taking someone else’s order.
(Translated by Google) I have eaten takeaways from friends many times, the taste is very good, authentic!  (Original) 吃过很多次朋友带来的外卖，味道非常好，正宗！

Very Authentic Sichuan Cuisine

Exceptional Szechuan cuisine. Top choice for us was the  Chengdu Sour Fish such we've had all over China (unfortunately not in Chengdu yet) and this was on part of better. The cabbage was also very well prepared. Flavorful yet still a bit crispy.

Wonderful "Lushan Sweet Duck." Fans of szechuan cuisine should check this place out when in Brooklyn's China Town.

Mostly good. We loved it when it first opened, but food has declined slightly in quality. Still worth a visit, but we hope they read this review and pay more attention to the consistency of the food. Love, love, love the Napa cabbage dish.
The best Szechuan style in the area
Ok but expensive food. What is funny is they check id when you check. One of the most funny they give I have ever seen.😂

Food is so so. Use one sause for two dishes. And they told me that the promotion is just for cash only and not allowing me to use it, disappointed.
(Translated by Google) The product is OK, the taste is lacking authentic and authentic, and the service attitude is commendable.  (Original) 出品還可以，味道缺正宗地道風味，服務態度值得讚揚
Food are delicious and 7 stars customer service,  highly recommended for spicy Sichuan style dish and will come back again!

We shared a variety of dishes in a group setting family style. This is a Szechuan style restaurant but it also has non Szechuan food for those who cannot eat very hot and spicy food. Loved their spicy pot of seafood and vegetables, spicy noodles, chicken with lots of hot peppers, the most tasty cauliflower I ever had, tasty peashoots and pretty good dumplings. Their service is excellent. But beware of their steps going up and even more going down where they seat larger groups. Not wheelchair accessible. Difficult for anyone with physical challenges. Also their bathroom downstairs was filthy. Only one for both men and women and the men left wetness around the toilet if you know what I mean. Had the bathroom been clean and the place more accessible would have given them  5 stars.
(Translated by Google) The food is really not good! ! ! no taste  (Original) 食物是真的不好吃！！！没味道

Was quite disappointed with the taste of the food especially since the interior and exterior made it look decent. Went with a group of 5 and ordered the Pork with Garlic Sauce, Chengdu Noodle, Potato Floss, Chengdu Wontons (they don’t have dumplings anymore is what they said), Pineapple Fried Rice, Hibachi Japanese Tofu and the Chongqing Sour Fish I believe.  Most of the dishes simply had the spicy oil, which had no taste. The Pork with Garlic Sauce, Potato Floss, Chengdu Wontons and Pineapple Fried Rice all tasted just mediocre, nothing too special that stood out, but didn’t taste terrible either. The Pineapple Fried Rice would’ve tasted better if there was more flavor, but it was too bland. I do not recommend the Chengdu Noodle because it’s not really noodles but some jello-like thing with no taste since it just had spicy oil. The Chongqing Sour Fish was simply fish (with some bones, not completely fillet style) with the preserved vegetable type of base. That was alright and had a big portion, but it just depends on your preferences.  The only dish that I did really like was the Hibachi Japanese Tofu as the sauce and egg tofu mixed well together. While the service was not bad, I was not particularly fond that they kept asking if we were ready to order every three minutes or so when it was evident we were still perusing the menu. The place also was not that big so we could have easily asked for a waiter/waitress to come over when we were ready. It was not near their closing time either so I was unsure why they kept questioning whether we were ready. Other than that, no major issues with the service since they were still pretty kind in informing us which dishes could be made non-spicy or less spicy as some of my friends could not take spice that well.
Delicious food, great service, and great atmosphere.
It was dope! Loved everything except the mapo tofu. The mapo tofu was very salty for my taste bud.
(Translated by Google) Bk best to eat frogs 😆  (Original) bk最好吃的田鸡了😆

Our favorite go to Szechuan restaurant in the area! We love everything about the place, from the service (fast, friendly and attentive), the decor (casual but tasteful), the thoughtful add ons like a basket for bags, and most of all the food!! We've tried 6 different dishes so far and we loved all but one.  The cold noodles, the poach beef with hot chilli and the Japanese tofu are our favorites. Looking forward to trying the other items on the menu!

Ordered 6 dishes, but was only able to take a photo of two of them because it was just that good! It was spicy, savory, and a high of sweetness. The food, atmosphere and service was top notch. Let's see more of these places through out New York!!
(Translated by Google) Eat spicy place  (Original) 吃辣地方

This place makes me rock hard  I go here sometimes twice week and it's always awesome service and awesome food.

I am glad this place exists in Brooklyn and I no longer need to travel to Manhattan for good Szechuan food.  The food I've tried from this place was delicious. I came here a few times before and I've been coming back again. It is one of the best Szechuan places I have tried so far. Every time I come, I bring a different group of people with me and they all complimented the food was good. This place has a variety of selections on the menu. And they serve a pot tea and refills it.  The only reason I gave them four stars is that the service was not great but not the worst neither. Just a bit above average in general. It's one of those typical Chinese services you couldn't ask for more. lol. An inexperienced waitress spilled chili sauce on my friend's new boot and she didn't apologize about it.  Well, the boot is difficult to clean especially when it was new. So it was a frustrating experience. We wanted the tip back :( Can't they train their new staffs appropriately?  Anyhow, I will come back for the food but just don't feel the tip is worth it to the terrible services sometimes...
Tasty food! The service was very good! Modern ambiance/music. I would like to come back and try some other dishes.
Very delicious

My family and I have actually come to this restaurant several times. The taste of the previous service and dishes has always been good, but recently I feel that the weight of the dishes is getting less and less, and the service is getting worse! Because I knew that they had preferential activities, the cash checkout was 8.5 discount.  Before the order, I asked the waiter to confirm it. It was correct. As a result, when I paid the bill, I gave it a discount of 9.5. I feel like I was cheated! Before serving, there was a free peanut gift. As the children were hungry, they quickly ate it. The waiter could come back for another dish. As a result, I gave a few peanuts. I asked if I could come more? Immediately they were told by their waitress to charge, it doesn't matter, there is no problem with the charges, we bought a peanut; we ordered the boiling fish and spicy double crisp because there is soup. After the meal, you can take the soup and bring it home to cook the noodles. As a result, the waiter dumped all of our soup, and only brought the side dishes left at the bottom of the pot to us! Every time we spend about $200, it is really difficult for me to accept such a service! Decided not to go to this restaurant again!

Came here with family for lunch. The place was very spacious. The tables each had a little basket for you to put your coat or bag and stuff into. The staff were welcoming and very attentive to your order and the stuff you need like napkins. There were quite a few variety to the menu. Their signature dish would be the 水煮鱼 or the spicy fish stew(?), and... spicy things 😁 🌶🌶 (tbh not... that spicy if you can eat spicy). We ordered the spicy beef stew, a dry roasted fish, the stir fry okra and the Cheng du cold noodles. Overall pretty good 👍. It was satisfying. (At the end of your meal, they give you a wet napkin and a mint with the check lol, just saying so u can expect that 🙃)
if you like spicy chinese/schechuan cuisine, this is THE place to go inr brooklyn!
Fantastic service. Very friendly, attentive, and fast. The food was also delicious, with a very extensive menu (with pictures!). Would highly recommend dinner here.

Excellent food. We got the chengdu col noodles, short ribs, pineapple rice and spicy chicken. All were amazing. We asked for mild spicyness and they honored it. The service is great as well. All waiters wear gloves!
Normal spicy Chinese restaurant, some dishes are excellent while some are meh, but you never know how it taste before you go in. Price wise it's expensive
Great with tasted food

My first time here and I loved it. Food was simply delicious, I was in love with the cabbage. Everything we ordered was really SPICY but nonetheless we  couldn't stop eating. I would recommend to any one who loves Szechuan cuisine
(Translated by Google) The waiter's attitude is very good. Food is generally speaking in general. Can also put  (Original) 服务员态度挺好 食物一般总体上来说。还可以把
Authentic Sichuan food that tastes great
Good place if u like spicy foods
Unreal

Great place if you enjoy spicy food. Even the peanuts they give you to munch have a kick! Had the Chengdu Noodle and the Chongqing Sour Fish. (There were two noodles on menu with same name, I had the JaJa Mein style ones)  The noodles were some of the tastiest I've had in this form. Portion wise I would say it's good as a small starter to share between two people. If I was having it as my main meal, I would need to have two orders but would be happy and full cause it was delicious.  The Sour Fish is definitely a share portion for 2 people, maybe 3 depending on what else you're ordering. Personally it was a bit on the spicy side for me, but my tolerance for spicy food is not high. Also, I'm not going to let that effect the rating as this is a Szechuan restaurant so you already know what you're getting yourself into.  I like this place because the food was flavorful, the wait staff was nice, and the presentation of the food was great. Will be coming back to try other items on the menu that caught my eye that I couldn't get to this time.
Didn't wait long for a table. The presentation of the food was good. The food was tad too salty and way too spicy for the general public. Staff were friendly.
Super friendly staff. Food is interesting and food.
O.M.G!!! It’s absolutely overrated!!!😤😤😤 I am from Szechuan, I’ve been really disappointed after tasting several times at this restaurant. And my friends thought so. It is so far from authentic! :(

CHINA 🇨🇳 (Sichuan) Eat the World NYC review: A group of ten of us, maybe the minimum for a family-style Sichuan feast, got together for a wonderful meal at brand new Chuan Tian Xia on Sunset Park's 7th Avenue. A new generation of Chinese immigrants seems to be keen on opening regional cuisines in this and other neighborhoods in the city with a lot of Chinese residents. This is probably the first one in Sunset Park to really excel at the craft of Sichuan cooking, and is a real welcome. Scroll through for 10 photos of some of the dishes we enjoyed, which while some were spicy the focus was more on sophisticated flavor profiles than on heat and numbing.

Food is absolutely delicious, especially in the Sunset Park area. Chongqing spicy is my favor, which is dry and spicy but without bones. Chongqing sour fish is also awesome, which includes a good sour soup. Besides, the servers are also kind and they always replace our play, refill water and give some ultra napkins. Over all, Highly recommend!!!
Excellent Sichuanese food!

Well. Food is good, although very limited choice on the menu. The service is not good. We have been to this restaurant four times after it's opening. Today , We ordered a tofu item on the menu as usual for the kids. My husband ordered without telling them to be non spicy. We admit the fault, but ask if they could change. Boy, did we have a hard time. Finally they took the tofu, and came back with same item except more watery. Will not come to this place again.

Excellent, fresh Szechuan food. Pleasant decor, fast service. Chinese pepper chicken - smooth and buttery, very fresh. I'll grade it A+  Tasty, crunchy mixed fungus. A.  Silver Sea perch (aka big mouth bass) fish - steamed first, then finished at the table, wrapped in paper with the sauce - we got the garlic sauce. It was very good, fresh, but i would put just a little less garlic, so that it doesn't overpower the flavor of the fish. A for taste, A+ for presentation.  Grilled okra was nice, I would go a little lighter on the oil, so I'll give it a B.
